edu.swarthmore.cs.spoon.interfaces

Interface Location

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    House

    public interface Location
    This indicates the varying locations of the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Location> accessibleLocations()
      A function for determining what Locations other than the current Location are accessible from the current Location
      java.util.List<Position> exitPositions()
      A function for determining where, on the player's current map, are exits from the current Location (and lead to another Location)
      java.util.List<Position> getLocationBoundaries()
      A function for getting the edge positions of a Location
      java.lang.String getLocationName()
      A function for getting the name of the location
      Thing getThingAtPosition(Position position)
      A function that retrieves a Thing at a given position.
      java.lang.Boolean locationActive()
      A function for determining whether or not a player is currently viewing or present in a location
      void setLocationBoundaries()
      A function for setting the Location's boundaries, so that we know what Positions actually exist within the Location, and what Positions don't exist within the Location.
      void setLocationName(java.lang.String string)
      A function for setting the name of the Location.
      void setThingAtPositions(Thing thing, java.util.List<Position> positions)
      A function for placing things at a given position or set of positions on the Location's map.
      java.util.List<Thing> thingsInThisLocation()
      A function for getting all the things at this location

    • Method Detail

      • setLocationName

        void setLocationName(java.lang.String string)
        A function for setting the name of the Location.
        Parameters:
        string, - a string that represents the name of the Location.

      • getLocationName

        java.lang.String getLocationName()
        A function for getting the name of the location
        Returns:
        a string indicating the name of the Location

      • setLocationBoundaries

        void setLocationBoundaries()
        A function for setting the Location's boundaries, so that we know what Positions actually exist within the Location, and what Positions don't exist within the Location.

      • getLocationBoundaries

        java.util.List<Position> getLocationBoundaries()
        A function for getting the edge positions of a Location
        Returns:
        a List of Position objects that are at the edges of the Location.

      • setThingAtPositions

        void setThingAtPositions(Thing thing,
                         java.util.List<Position> positions)
        A function for placing things at a given position or set of positions on the Location's map.
        Parameters:
        positions, - an array of Position objects that one would like to analyze

      • getThingAtPosition

        Thing getThingAtPosition(Position position)
        A function that retrieves a Thing at a given position.
        Parameters:
        position: - the position that one would like to analyze for a Thing
        Returns:
        returns the Thing at the given location OR null if no Environmental Object was found.

      • locationActive

        java.lang.Boolean locationActive()
        A function for determining whether or not a player is currently viewing or present in a location
        Returns:
        a boolean, true if a player is in the location, and false if a player is not in the location.

      • accessibleLocations

        java.util.List<Location> accessibleLocations()
        A function for determining what Locations other than the current Location are accessible from the current Location
        Returns:
        a list of Location objects that are accessible from the player's current Location

      • exitPositions

        java.util.List<Position> exitPositions()
        A function for determining where, on the player's current map, are exits from the current Location (and lead to another Location)
        Returns:
        a List of Position objects, indicating x and y coordinates on the map for exit Locations (exits to other Locations)

      • thingsInThisLocation

        java.util.List<Thing> thingsInThisLocation()
        A function for getting all the things at this location
        Returns:
        a List of all the Things that are at this Location
